title: Constitution of Zambia Act—Proclamation—Declaration of Threatened State of Public Emergency
content:
Supplement to the Republic of Zambia Government 389
Gazette dated Wednesday, 5th July, 2017
GOVERNMENT OF ZAMBIA
STATUTORY INSTRUMENT NO.53 OF2017
The Constitution of Zambia
(ActNo.1of 1991)
Proclamation
Declaration of Threatened State of Public Emergency
WHEREASit is providedunderArticle31ofthe Constitutionof
Zambia that the President may at any time by Proclamation
publishedintheGazettedeclarethatasituationexistswhich,ifitis
allowedtocontinue,mayleadtoastateofpublicemergency:
NOWTHEREFORE,underandbyvirtueofthepowersinme,vested,
I, EDGAR CHAGWA LUNGU, President of the Republic of
Zambia, do hereby declare that a situation exists which, if it is
allowedtocontinue,mayleadtoastateofemergency.
GIVEN under my hand and the Public Seal of the Republic at
Lusakathis5thdayofJuly,2017.
SEAL
EDGARC.LUNGU,
LUSAKA President
5thJuly,2017
